items.message: River levels have risen rapidly as a result of intense heavy rainfall due to thunderstorm activity. Consequently, flooding of property is imminent. We believe there is a possibility of flooding for Victoria Ave, Kings Rd, Chestnut Mew, Church Hill, Springfield Rd, Cornwall Rd, Commerical Rd, Station Rd, Institute Rd, The Square, Shore Rd, High St and Parade in Swanage. River levels can rise very quickly in response to heavy rainfall. We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are checking defences. Please can owners with property flood resilience equipment install it now. There is no further heavy rainfall forecast at this point. This message will be updated on Monday morning, or as the situation changes.

River levels at the Pillings Lock river gauge no longer pose a risk of flooding.

The risk of heavy showers remains throughout this morning and afternoon, before clearing into the evening and overnight tonight. We are not expecting to see any flooding impacts, but will continue to monitor the situation and re-issue this Flood Alert is necessary.

Please see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.
